text.content: Deep Isolation Forest for Anomaly Detection

title.plain_text: Deep Isolation Forest for Anomaly Detection

text.content: This paper introduce a new representation scheme that utilizes casually initialized neural networks to map original data into random representation ensembles, where random axis-parallel cuts are subsequently applied to perform the data partition

rich_text.plain_text: This paper introduce a new representation scheme that utilizes casually initialized neural networks to map original data into random representation ensembles, where random axis-parallel cuts are subsequently applied to perform the data partition

text.content: An explicit major issue is that iForest cannot handle hard anomalies because it treats all features separately and considers only one feature per isolation operations

rich_text.plain_text: An explicit major issue is that iForest cannot handle hard anomalies because it treats all features separately and considers only one feature per isolation operations

text.content: Another inherent imperfection of iForest is that it assigns unexpectedly low anomaly scores to artifacts introduced by the algorithm itself.

rich_text.plain_text: Another inherent imperfection of iForest is that it assigns unexpectedly low anomaly scores to artifacts introduced by the algorithm itself.

text.content: This paper proposes a novel extension of iForest named Deep Isolation Forest(DIF). The key idea in DIF is to harness the strong representation power of neural networks to map the original data into a group of new data spaces, and non-linear isolation can be easily achieved by performing simple axis-parallel partitions upon these newly created data spaces.

rich_text.plain_text: This paper proposes a novel extension of iForest named Deep Isolation Forest(DIF). The key idea in DIF is to harness the strong representation power of neural networks to map the original data into a group of new data spaces, and non-linear isolation can be easily achieved by performing simple axis-parallel partitions upon these newly created data spaces.
